input_tables.name: inputtable
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input parameters.
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the input parameters.

output_tables.name: CoefficientTable
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table where the function outputs the estimated coefficients of the input parameters.
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table where the function outputs the estimated coefficients of the input parameters.

output_tables.name: LinearPredictorTable
output_tables.description: The linear_predictor_table is a required argument clause.
output_tables.rDescription: The linear_predictor_table is a required argument clause.

argument_clauses.name: time_interval_column
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the column in input_table that contains the time intervals of the input parameters; that is, end_time - start_time, in any unit of time (for example, years, months, or days).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column in input_table that contains the time intervals of the input parameters; that is, end_time - start_time, in any unit of time (for example, years, months, or days).

argument_clauses.name: event_column
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the column in input_table that contains 1 if the event occurred by end_time and 0 if it did not. (0 represents survival or right-censorship.) The function ignores values other than 1 and 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column in input_table that contains 1 if the event occurred by end_time and 0 if it did not. (0 represents survival or right-censorship.) The function ignores values other than 1 and 0.

argument_clauses.name: feature_columns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the features of the input parameters.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the features of the input parameters.

argument_clauses.name: categorical_columns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain categorical predictors. Each categorical_column must also be a feature_column. By default, the function detects the categorical columns by their SQL data types.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain categorical predictors. Each categorical_column must also be a feature_column. By default, the function detects the categorical columns by their SQL data types.

argument_clauses.name: accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in input_table that the function copies to linear_predictor_table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in input_table that the function copies to linear_predictor_table.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations that the function runs before finishing, if the convergence threshold has not been met. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations that the function runs before finishing, if the convergence threshold has not been met. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: Threshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the convergence threshold. The default value is 0.000000001.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the convergence threshold. The default value is 0.000000001.
